module.title: Terminal & CLI
module.description: Master the command line interface for efficient development

lessons.title: Why Use the Terminal?
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- Terminal gives direct access to your computer
- Faster than GUIs for many tasks
- Essential for development workflows
- Same commands work across projects

---

# TODO: Content about terminal vs GUI, shells (bash, zsh), terminal emulators, why developers use CLI

lessons.title: Navigating the File System
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- pwd shows current directory
- ls lists files and folders
- cd changes directory
- Paths: absolute (/Users/...) vs relative (./folder)

---

# TODO: Content about pwd, ls (with flags -la, -h), cd, . and .., ~, tab completion, clear

lessons.title: Working with Files
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- touch creates files, mkdir creates folders
- cp copies, mv moves/renames
- rm removes (careful! no trash)
- cat, less, head, tail to view files

---

# TODO: Content about file operations, flags (-r for recursive), wildcards (*), viewing file contents

lessons.title: File Permissions
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- Three permissions: read (r), write (w), execute (x)
- Three groups: owner, group, others
- chmod changes permissions
- sudo runs as administrator

---

# TODO: Content about reading permissions (ls -l), chmod numeric and symbolic, chown, when to use sudo

lessons.title: Searching & Finding
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- find locates files by name/type
- grep searches file contents
- Combine with pipes for power
- Modern alternatives: fd, ripgrep

---

# TODO: Content about find command, grep basics, piping (|), common search patterns, modern tools (fd, rg)

lessons.title: Environment Variables
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- Variables store configuration values
- export makes them available to child processes
- PATH tells shell where to find commands
- .bashrc/.zshrc run on shell start

---

# TODO: Content about echo $VAR, export, PATH variable, shell config files, persistent vs session variables

lessons.title: Input/Output & Pipes
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- > redirects output to file (overwrites)
- >> appends to file
- | pipes output to another command
- Chain commands for powerful workflows

---

# TODO: Content about stdout/stderr, redirection operators, piping, tee, practical examples

lessons.title: Shell Scripts Basics
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- Scripts are files with shell commands
- Start with #!/bin/bash (shebang)
- Make executable with chmod +x
- Variables, conditionals, loops

lessons.title: Terminal Productivity
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- history shows past commands
- Ctrl+R for reverse search
- aliases create shortcuts
- Tab completion saves typing
